description:
**Fix Overview**:

To address the Windows DWM core library elevation of privilege vulnerability (CVE-2024-43629), you should apply the relevant security updates available for your version of Windows.

1. Identify your Windows version and build number from the list provided below.
2. Locate the corresponding KB articles for your system:
   - Windows 11 Version 24H2: [KB5046617](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5046617)
   - Windows 11 Version 23H2: [KB5046633](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5046633)
   - Windows 11 Version 22H2: [KB5046633](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5046633)
   - Windows 10 Version 22H2: [KB5046613](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5046613)
   - Windows 10 Version 21H2: [KB5046613](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5046613)
3. Download and install the updates from the links provided.
4. Restart your system to ensure the updates are applied.

**Details**:
- The updates rectify the untrusted pointer dereference issue which could potentially allow an attacker to elevate privileges on the affected system.
- Make sure to back up critical data before proceeding with installations, as unexpected behaviors can occur during updates.

**Build Numbers**:
- Windows 11 Version 24H2 for x64-based: 10.0.26100.2314
- Windows 11 Version 23H2 for x64-based: 10.0.22631.4460
- Windows 11 Version 22H2 for x64-based: 10.0.22621.4460
- Windows 10 Version 22H2 for x64-based: 10.0.19045.5131
- Windows 10 Version 21H2 for x64-based: 10.0.19044.5131.
